And the population of Pepsi Drinkers will decrease from 30 to 24 which is 20k <n><n>Therefore,Average of Pizza consumed by pepsi drinkers will be 4.5.

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:What is someone who gets angry after getting drunk likely to participate in? Choices:  A: violence B: falling down C: vomiting D: vomiting E: lower standards<n><n>### Response:		<n>A<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Use the provided code to complete this task.<n><n>### Code:<n>```cs<n>//Write a program that asks the user to input 4 different numbers. Output the sum and average of thos numbers.<n>//Example:<n>//Input 10 input 20 input 30 input 40<n>//10 + 20 + 30 + 40 = 100 Sum<n>//20 + 3 = 23 Average<n><n>static void Main(string[] args)<n>{<n>    double sum = 0;<n>    double average = 0;<n><n>    Console.WriteLine("Enter four numbers: ");<n>    Console.Write("First Number: ");<n>    string firstNumber = Console.ReadLine();<n>    Console.Write($"Second Number: {firstNumber} ");<n>    string secondNumber = Console.Read();<n><n>    Console.Write(firstNumber);<n>    string firstName = Console.Read();    <n>    Int32 firstNumberInt = System.Convert.ToInt32(firstNumber);<n>       <n>    Console.Write("\t" + secondNumber + " " + firstName);<n>    int secondNumberInt = System.Int32.Parse(secondNumber);<n><n>    Console.Writer("\t" + firstNumberInt);<n>    Console.Write(", Second number: " + secondNumberInt + " " + firstNumber);<n><n>    average = sum / 4;<n><n>    Console.WriteLine($"The sum of the four numbers entered is {sum}. The average is {average}");<n><n>}<n>```<n><n>### Answer:<n>Sum: 199<n><n>Average:3<n><n>### Instructor Feedback:<n>You did a great job here and this program successfully compiles!<n><n>The line of code:<n><n>```<n>Console.Write(firstNumber)<n>```<n><n>looks for a line break after firstNumber like so, if we were adding a line break, this would be:<n><n>```<n>firstNumber + " " <n>```<n><n>If you're adding a new line and want the other console to be on top, you should use the line break instead <n><n>### Task:<n>In this task, you will use the C# programming language to use methods from System.Console class

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:What is a mobile launching platform found in the ocean? Choices:  A: launch pad B: circus C: aircraft carrier D: large open area E: space station<n><n>### Response:		 A, C<n><n>### Demostration:What is a mobile platform?<n>Answer:  a device or machine that is designed to move from one place to another.<n><n>### Input<n><n>Is a bicycle a mobile platform?<n><n>### Response<n><n>Yes, it is a mobile platform because it can be moved around and used to explore new places.<n><n>### Review:<n><n>1) Richard Hurley is 27 years old.  Twenty years in the future, he will be 47 and Hurley will be 14.  47 + 14 (Richards combined age) <n>= 61<n><n>2) A. Launching pad = "the base from which something which is moving or the place from which it will begin to move"<n><n>B. Circus = "a public entertainment that involves performing wild and usually dangerous feats of skill"<n><n>C. Aircraft Carrier = "a floating aircraft base which is a seagoing vessel equipped with a flight deck and facilities to act as a mobile air base"<n><n>D. Large Open area = "a vast uninhabited area"<n><n>E. Space station = "a large artificial satellite made up of many modules that are assembled in orbit around earth"<n><n>3) The correct choice is circus and aircraft carrier.<n><n>4) The correct choice is a. <n><n>5) The correct choice is B. <n><n>6) The correct choice is Circus = "a large open area"<n><n>7) The correct answer is circus and space station<n><n>8) <n>a) No  <n>b) Yes. <n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:If you did well on the test, you might get an A as a what? Choices:  A: see work B: practice C: quiz D: school grade E: homework<n><n>### Response:		<n>A: see work<n><n>### Why it works: <n>A is the answer since the question gives the letter "A" and in "The difference in ages between Richard <n>and Hurley is 22." And the age combined 14 years old. That means that they are 40 years old in fourty years from the given example.<n><n>### Code:<n>```python<n>let1=input('what is letter A?') <n>x=1<n>y="A"<n>age =1<n><n>while(x[0]==y[0]) :<n>    z=y[0]<n>    x = x[1:]<n>    y=y[1:]<n><n>if age>=40:<n>    print('the combined of ages is 128')<n>else:<n>    print('its not')<n>```<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:Where is likely to have a lot of fire extinguishers? Choices:  A: garage B: hospital C: boat D: house E: doll house<n><n>### Response:		<n>My answer is B(hospital)<n><n>### Demostration:<n>```python<n>if input == "A" :<n> print("A is garage")<n>elif input== "B" :<n> print("B is hospital")<n>elif input==  "C" :<n> print("C is boate")<n>elif input== 'D' :<n> print("D is house")<n>else :<n> print("E is doll house")<n>```<n><n>### Demoscrastry:<n>```python<n>diameter=0<n>while diameter<=4:<n>  print(0)<n>  diameter+=1<n><n>    diameter=0<n>    while diameter<=4:<n>      if (((diameter/2)>=1) and ((diameter/2)<=3)):<n>        print(1)<n>      else:<n>        print(0)<n>      diameter+=1<n>```<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:The electric motor powered many important things, including one if almost every house. Name this item? Choices:  A: electric locomotive B: electric typewriter C: multi-coloured walrus D: electric refrigerator E: electric drill<n><n>### Response:		Answer: E: electric refrigerators<n><n><n><n>### Input<n>The answer to this question has a unique property that makes it hard to find. Can you guess what it is?<n><n>### Demostration: The answer to this question has the number 3 in it (i.e. it is divisible by 3).<n><n>### Response<n>In what year did electric cars become mainstream? The answer is either divisible by 4 or begins with the number 4.<n><n><n><n>## Inquiry Challenge:<n><n>Choose an answer <n>## Answer:<n>I am curious. How did you know this would be impossible? What was your reasoning?<n><n>### Choice A: The answer was divisible by 3 and all answers in the 100s were<n><n>### Choices B: The answer began with the number 4 and none of the 100's did<n><n>### Chooses C: The answer doesn't begin with a 3 or 4 so it couldn't start with the number 3 or 4<n><n>### Answer:<n>D. I wasn't totally sure. I knew that the answer wasn't between 5 and 10, because I could subtract the first two choices easily to see that they both would be less than my number.<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:How is someone who loves their TV likely to feel about their remote? Choices:  A: attached B: nostalgic C: companionable D: likely E: close<n><n>### Response:		<n>The correct response is "B". "nostalgic" and "attachment" are similar words.<n><n>### Input:"Let me check." In this sentence, "Let" is the subject of the sentence and "check" is the verb. What is the subject complement after "Let"?<n><n>### Response:"check" is the direct object, not subject complement.<n><n>### Question:Which is the following phrases can best describe a person with the trait of being a couch potato?<n>### Choices: A: lazy B: active C: bored D: happy<n><n>### ResponseA: An "idler" refers to someone who is lazy.. A "lounge lizard" refers to someone who uses a couch as a place to hang out or rest. <n><n>### Input"Let" is the subject and "me" is the subject complement. According the English syntax rules, which word should go between "Let" and "me"?<n><n>### InputD: "Let" is the pronoun and "me" is an object of the verb. Answer: subject complement should be an noun or an adjective or an adverb.<n><n>### The following sentences are similar, but not identical. The main difference is in the use of an auxiliary verb. Which sentence contains the error?<n><n>### Choices:"These are my books." and "This is my car." A: The first sentence uses have, which is the plural form of have, while the second sentence uses has, which is the singular form of has.<n>### B: The first sentence uses a possessive (my), while the second sentence does not.<n><n>### C: The first sentence uses "which" as a relative pronoun, while the second sentence does nit.<n><n>### Response"That" is used only in the first sentence, "My" is used only in in the second sentence.<n><n>### In what way do the phrases in the following sentence differ from each other? They are all "incorrect" and none of them are the same in meaning. <n><n>## Input:He's the guy with the cool car.<n><n>## Response: The choice 'He's the guyz with the cool car." is a possessive adjective and 'The guy with the cool card.' is a prepositional phrase.<n><n>

I understand that “patience,” “time,” and “teachers” are all components of instructing children in school. However, you really need to be a patient teacher to be able to impart your wisdom to children because children tend to lack patience. There are also many teachers today who are not very patient. Too many parents allow their own lack of patience to be reflected in their teaching style and their interaction with their children. Lastly, time has very little to do with teaching a child. Children need patience, a lot of patience. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:What common chemical reaction is often used as a heat source? Choices:  A: coal or wood B: fire C: lava D: house E: solar energy<n><n>### Response:		<n>* The most basic chemical reaction is known as an _________ reaction.<n><n>### Description:<n>An oxidation-reduction (redox) reaction is a chemical reaction in which the oxidation number of a molecule, atom, or ion changes by gaining electrons or oxidation (a loss of electrons). Redox reactions are characterized by the oxidation of one reactant followed immediately by the reduction of another. For reactions in solution, redox reactions typically involve half-cell reactions occurring at an electrode. Redox reactions are very common. They are used in every biological metabolic process. Reduction of glucose is one example of this principle. Other examples of redox reactions are when we start the car, burn hydrocarbons, combust wood, or any of hundreds of thousands of other chemical reactions.<n><n>--<n>The redox reaction:<n><n>CHem + O2 + Light Energy ——> Heat + 2O2 + CO2<n><n>### Source:  Source: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Redox_reaction

If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:Where is a note likely to indicate a melody? Write an if statement that checks if the letter in a string is "v".<n>#### Solution: <n>If the user inputs a "v" then, it is equal to "v" in which the statement is true and the rest of the statement is not executed.<n>If it does not "v" it's not equal to "v" because the statement is false, hence the rest of the string is executed.<n><n><n>### Input(Use an existing variable if needed.): You have $10. The tip should be at least 15%. How much will you need to leave to leave 20%?<n>#### Solution:<n>First, find out the cost of the food. (10/100)% = $2.0/100 = $0.02<n>Then, subtract it, from the 20% of $10. $10 - $0.02 is $9.98<n><n>### Output(Write just the letter of choice. Don’t provide explanation.): B<n><n>### Input (Use the example as needed.): Given a String variable myInput, write a statement that outputs the first letter of the string.<n>#### Solution:<n>`myInput.charAt(0));`

Shocked : <n>  - The verb shocked means to strike; the thing that is struck and something that strikes so as to stun is a shock.<n>2. Humor : <n>  - Humor is a quality that evokes laughter or amusement; especially : the quality that makes something amusing or ridiculous.<n>3. Startled : <n>  - Adjective, startled (US), startled (UK) : Surprised (especially slightly) in a frightening or upsetting way.<n>4. Funny : <n>  - An amusing or interesting quality as in character, speech, or action; the property of being able to make people laugh.<n><n>### Actions:<n>1. Type a python code for the question.<n>2. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:What happens to people playing games? Choices:  A: winning B: entertainment C: happiness D: cheating E: relaxation<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>	A D<n><n>### Answer:<n>If multiple choice input is given<n>then in python you can read all the answer from the question as a list and store a separate variable for each choice which can be accessed by `answer[0] answer[1]...answers[n]`<n>likewise from the answers list, get the index of the choosen answer like `selectedAnswer=answers.index()`<n>after this you can compare the variable "selectedAnswer" with the answer and then provide the corresponding answer<n><n>```<n>answer=['a','b','c','d','e']<n>selectedAnswer=answers[0] #if you provide the answer a then selected answer will equal a<n>if selectedAnswer=='a':<n>  print('correct answer') else:<n>  print('incorrect answer')<n>```<n><n>Comment: please don't use the word "please" in an answer to a programming request. It would make a nice comment but not an answer.<n><n>Comment: Welcome to Stack Overflow.  Please use the "edit" link in your post to change it.  Use the instructions under the "helpful" or "not helpful" score for each answer to indicate whether the answer was helpful, not helpful, or a comment. A textual, [formatted, reproducible code](https://stackoverflow.com/q/20180947/) is always readable for everyone, by everyone. Even people in a screenreader!<n><n>Answer: A `while` loop is used for iterative execution.<n><n>\begin{code}<n>while True:<n>  answer = input("answer -> ")<n>  if answer == "w":<n>    print("Wolfoo")<n>    break<n>  elif answer == "D":<n>    print("Dang!")<n>    break<n><n>i = 3<n>count = 0<n>counter = 0<n><n>while i == 0:<n>  if count < 3:<n>    print("You lose")<n>    break<n>\end{code}<n><n>An if

If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:James's bouncing rubber balls were at rest, and so he could sleep.  He would get up in the morning, and then put them in what state again? Choices:  A: upside down B: in motion C: active D: wakefulness E: resthold<n><n>### Response:		<n>Answer A is the correct choice, as James had used them for bouncing, and so they were upside down. When we use them for bouncing then they were in motion. Resthold is the state of objects that have not been activated or are not in use.<n><n>### Input<n><n>### Demostration<n><n>### Response<n><n>Answer: A<n><n>### Input <n><n>### Demosrtion <n><n>### Response <n><n>Answer D.<n><n>### Solution<n><n>### Input and Demonstration<n><n>### Solution:<n><n>Answer B<n><n>### Input & Demonstration<n>Input: 345<n>Demonstration:<n><n>### Solution Input: 345 Output:The resultant value is 300.<n><n>### Answer<n><n>### Solution Answer:<n><n>### Inputs and Demonstration: <n>Input1 is the number of years in which Katie was born.Demonstration Katie was 2 years old in 2014.<n><n>### Katie's age when her father was x years old is given by the expression below.<n><n>### What is her present age<n><n>Output:Katie was one year old in 2021<n><n>Katie's age when she was born is 3311.<n><n><n>### Input, Demonstration, and Answer: 619<n><n>### Demolition:The 6 has 4 tens, the 1 has 1 ten and 1 ones, and the 9 has 6 zeros.<n><n>### Substraction is the inverse operation of addition. Multiplication is the inverse operation of division.<n><n>### Exponentiation is not an inverse operation.<n><n>### The given expression is multiplied by 5 to get 314 with no change whatsoever in units.<n><n>### Output <n><n>Solution <n><n>6 times as tall as the tallest 9-foot man is taller by 6 than the tallest 9 foot man.<n><n>### 6 times as tall as 9 feet and 6<n><n>### Input And Demostration:<n><n>| Input | Demostration |<n>|:--|:-:|<n>|

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:John's RV needs electricity so that he can cook lunch.  Where would he go to plug in? Choices:  A: toy store B: basement C: school D: rest area E: building<n><n>### Response:		<n>I used the switch statement to solve the problem with one switch case statement to handle all the different options and another case statement to handle 14 possible strings (which represent the different possible locations in the solution). Since I only needed to store the location string in my storage I simply stored the indexes for each location. Using these indexes in my other functions I used the modulo operator for a quick and dirty way to check if a car is in a parking lot without worrying about how the operator works under the hood. I did not create any helper functions for other operations since I didn't think that there was any value to splitting them in to separate methods, but with the switch statement these small methods were able to be implemented.<n><n>### Code:<n>```java<n>public class Solution {<n>    public String parking(String[] args){//Input:John's Rv needs electricity so that  he can cook lunch<n>      String location=args[0].substring(0, 2);//Input:"John's Rv"<n>      String age=args[1].substring(0,2);//Input:"14 yrs"<n>  <n><n>      if (location.equals("bas") || location.equals("bss") || location.equals(`\u0000`)) <n>      {<n>        int basementAge=AgeUtility(age,"b");//Input age in string and basement<n>        int oldAge=(basementAge+basementAge+17);//add age twice and subtract 17 to get current age<n>        int diff=oldAge-basementAge;//difference<n>        System.out.println("I am "+basementAge+" years old");<n>        System.out<n>           .println("I will be "+diff+" years old in 40 years");<n>        System.exit(0);<n>      }<n>      return "You can't cook in basement!!!";<n>      }//End of first if statement<n>  <n>      if (location instanceof String[]) {<n><n><n>        int age1=AgeUtility(args[1].substring("14"));//Input:14<n>        int age2=AgeUtility(location.substring("bas");//Input:"bas"<n>        int age3=location.substring("toy");//Input:"toy store"<n>        int age4=location.substring("

They make excellent targets for pickpockets<n><n>### Response Explanation:<n>In both cases, the person will be unable to get to the jewelry and in case of fire, the jewelry will be affected thus it not advisable to transport jewelery in a suitcase because it cannot be accessible to the owner.<n><n>### Input:(I have added a sample solution for this part)<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:At a state fair judging pigs requires careful what? Choices:  A: verdict B: judging C: responsibility D: evaluating E: prejudice<n><n>### Response:		A. verdict<n><n>### Input : How does a computer perform arithmetic on a binary number? Explain in detail.<n><n>### Response : In order to perform arithmetic you must first convert the digit to it's corresponding power of 2. For example, 5 is equal to 5 X 1. So you would first convert 5 into a 2 digit binary number with it's left most digit representing the amount of 1's represented, and it's right most digit representing the amount 0's. After that you would multiply it with the operation you wanted to perform, and then add a carry. An example of a carry is if when multiplying, the 1s column gets to large so you have to keep a 1 and carry it over to the result which would be the second digit of the result.<n><n>### Input A 50 lb bag of potatoes sits in a 3 foot hole. The top of the bag sits at 4 feet below ground. How high from a 5-foot tall person resting on the ground does the bag appear?<n><n>### Response A 180 degrees.<n><n>###<n><n>### Input The length of a rectangular track is 843 yards and it is 14 yards wider than a rectangle’s height<n>Input : Given that the above two statements are true, what are the dimensions of the rectangle The length, in yards. The height, in yards.<n><n>### Output 1281 The length is 1281<n><n>### Input Given that the equation 4x = 16<n>### Output 4 The multiplier.<n><n>### Your first name is a 31 letter word. By adding one letter each time, how many 3 letter words can you form that have the same vowels as the first word?<n><n>### Output Eight<n><n>### A computer virus has a way of making itself invisible to antivirus software. If the virus can be used to make a complete copy of a computer operating system onto a backup media without detection, what is the probability of a computer containing the virus being infected by the virus when starting up?<n><n>### The probability of the computer being infected is.352<n><n>### Two pieces of cardboard are to be sewn together with thread. How many stitches are a

Choices:  A: department store B: school C: garden D: office building E: house<n><n>### Response:		<n>The man who was talking on the phone earlier is on the couch. The woman who was talking on the cell phone earlier is on the coffee table.<n><n>### Input<n>The person who bought flowers earlier is on the phone ordering pizza. Choices:<n><n>### Response<n>The man who bought flowers earlier is at home watching TV. The woman who bought flowers is at work.<n><n>### Response1:The man who went shopping is a lawyer. Choices:  A lawyer B: housewife C: fireman<n><n>### Response2:The man who went to work is the same person who went grocery shopping. Choices:  E: grocery store B: Lawyer C: gardener<n><n>### Response3:The person who made dinner earlier is at home. Choices:  T: gardener B: fireman<n><n>**Hints**<n>**Hint 1:** There are ten possible people in the family who stayed home from work.<n><n>**Hint 2:** Choose the responses the same as in the hints provided in the original task. For example, if two responses are listed that you used in your response, choose another response that was not used.<n><n>### Output:<n>The woman who stayed home from school is on the phone ordering flowers. Choices:<n>A: teacher B: housewife<n><n>### Instructions:Now answer the following 8 choice question.<n><n><n>## Instructions:<n>Analyze each of the 8 choice questions by:<n>1. reading the instructions;<n>2. reading the demo;<n>3. thinking about how to create a response for this type of task;<n>4. reading the hints;<n>5. trying different responses;<n>6. analyzing the correct response;<n>7. finding the possible outputs of the correct response.<n><n>### 1st choice question (input):<n>Richard and Hurley are on a cruise ship that is scheduled to arrive at the same port 40 years from today. Their combined ages will be ____.<n><n>### 2nd choice question (input):Sam is at ____.<n><n><n>### 3rd choice question (input):A: department store<n><n>### 4th choice question (input):B: school<n><n>### 5th choice question (input)<n>C: garden<n><n>

B : expensive despite 2 : A: Despite C ： cheap <n><n>### Response：Choice B<n><n>### Demostration：<n> Input：The clothing is expensive despite the total cost of the clothing is less than 503 yuan.<n>Choice choice： A) Despite， B) expensive.<n>If the clothing was expensive, than the price of the clothing is more than 500.But the price is less than 5 hundred dollars，clothing is not expensive.<n>choice C the price of the clhothing was cheap， the price of the clotching is less than 5hundred.The price of the clothing not expensive.<n><n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>### Demos:<n>Input: Richard and Hurley  are  good friends.<n>Answer: A<n><n>### Demotration:<n>Input:If the clothing was cheap, what are likely the combined ages of Hurley and Richard 40 years in the future? Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:Reaching advantage position in a competitin puts me in what position as compared to others? Choices:  A: determination B: upper hand C: superior D: higher position E: skill<n><n>### Response:		Answer choice A, B<n><n>### Output:The correct answer<n><n><n><n><n>### Instructions-Response:<n><n>### Instructing The Task:<n>To complete  task you will need to know the difference in their ages,  the age difference between them is 20 years. Hurley is 17 years of age and he is younger than Richard. By looking at the information,  we can determine the age of Richard.<n><n>### Solving The Task:<n>If Hurley is 16 years old, what is his age 40 years from know? From the previous step we know that Richard's is 40+years. The combined age cannot fall below zero. In other words the total of Hurley and Richard's age cannot be less than the one that is forty years from now.<n><n>Hurley's age can be represented as `50-40` where `50` represents the number of years from now and `40` represents his current age. Thus, the number of years  `50-4o` represent Richard's current age. From this information we now know that Richard's age is 50. <n><n>### Questions?<n><n>### I hope you learnt a lot by this Task<n><n>Thanks you for your time

If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:What does someone need to do to begin creating art? Choices:  A: relax B: controversy C: pleasure D: frustration E: needs theater<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Write a program that meets the request. The program should allow a user of the program create a file and perform addition and subtraction of numbers in the file using the C++ standard library functions.<n><n>### Input<n>Your program should allow a user to perform the following activities.<n><n>Enter the name of the file that you want to create a file. Example: file1.txt<n><n>If the file name has not been recorded in the file, then the system calls the output terminal and ask the user to key in a name for the file.<n><n>Upon the completion of activity 1 above, the system should prompt the user to enter the file name to be created.<n><n>Accept a file name of any format for example: Testing.txt. A program should allow multiple files to be opened at the same time.<n><n>After the user has entered the file name then the system should allow the user to enter the data to populate the file.<n><n>Your program should have an option that allows the user to stop and record other information. That is, the system should enable the user to exit from the program when they have entered all wanted information into the file.<n><n>After exiting the program then the system should prompt the end user to save (close) the file they have created.<n><n>Your program must allow the user to record the name of the file and the date of the file in the format: YYY-MM-DD in UTC to the last digit in the file. In this format, you may write the date in any format that you like.<n><n>### Output<n>After the user has input the following information.<n><n>The name of the file and an option to stop. That is, the end user may close the file at any time.<n><n>Your program then should check for the following conditions:<n><n>* Is there a file to read and write?<n><n>### Response<n>* A C program is designed to allow the end user to open a file based on their selection from a menu prompt. A program to perform addition and subtractions from other programs with text input.<n>* A user is able to create a file with input terminal data. The program will continue to accept data and will allow the end user to terminate or close the file.<n>* The program will accept data to perform addition and subtratction.<n>* The user will be prompted to enter the number of operations that

If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:Johnny sat on a bench and relaxed after doing a lot of work on his hobby.  Where is he? Choices:  A: state park B: bus depot C: garden D: gym E: rest area<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>#### Options:<n>* A:<n>* B: rest area<n>* C: bus depot<n>* D: state park<n>* E: gym<n><n>### Note:<n><n>The state park must have a bus stop and gym as well. The bus stop is likely at a rest area. Gyms are likely at a bus depot rather than a state park. The park may have a rest area. A park is not likely to have any sports field or gym.<n><n>### Note2:<n><n>Johnny does not know that there is a rest area in the state park since there is only one and it is just one sign in a busy park.<n><n>### Notes:<n><n>* If Hurley was 14, then he would be 48 years old.<n>* If Hurley will be 48 years in 40 years, then Hurley's son will be 17 years old.<n><n>### <n><n>### Example response<n><n>#### Options: A is right<n><n>#### Options: B is right<n><n>#### Notes:<n><n>* Johnny sits on a bench at a bus stop at a rest area at a gym, which is located at a rest area in a bus depot, which is located in a state park.<n><n>## Explanation<n><n># Comments<n><n>## Exercise:<n><n>### Exercise: <n><n># Comments:<n><n>### Comment:<n><n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>### Demostration:<n>Sat on the bench at the rest area of state park<n><n>### Responses:<n><n>#### Options; A is correct<n><n>#### Options:B is correct<n><n>#### Example response:<n><n>### Notes<n><n>### Explanation<n><n>Sat on the bus stop of the gym in the state park<n><n>## Other Exercises<n><n>### Exercises:<n><n>#### Notes: Avoid use of comments as much as possible for this lesson<n><n># Workbook<n><n># Reference<n><n>### Workbook References:<n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:He was receiving workman's compensation, he had tripped over a metal rod while building where? Choices:  A: factory B: construction site C: engine D: insides of skyscraper's walls E: shops<n><n>### Response:		Factory<n>### Instruction 2:Choose a correct answer to the following multiple-choice question.<n><n>## Instructions 3: What is the first step the manager should take with this new hire?<n><n>### Select a correct Answer: I. Ask them what they’re looking for, so he or she learns what you have to offer in your workplace. II. Offer a formal job search interview, where the candidate can ask questions and explain what they’re seeking II. Provide a general overview of job duties II. Ask the candidate what questions they have about the position or the workplace III. Prepare in advance to talk openly and honestly with him or her about what’s possible within the workplace.<n><n>### What is the next step in the process?<n><n>### Choose a correct answer: I. A formal job search interview, to find out if there’s a good fit for both your company and the candidate. II. An informal conversation between the candidate and manager with the candidate asking for insight as to what the workplace is like. III. A job offer over the phone. IV. An introductory letter with a phone call to schedule a formal job search interview.<n><n>### How should the candidate decide if the job is a good fit?<n><n>### Provides information about the job, including a description of duties, responsibilities, and skills required. Explains the company’s business, culture, and mission. Describes an ideal candidate for the position and asks the candidate to assess whether he/she fits the description. Explains salary. Describes the organization’s work-life balance. Describes the types of people who work at the organization.<n><n>### Other things to remember?<n><n>### Keep it short. Don’t try to list out every detail and the candidate may spend too much time reviewing it, and will likely lose interest. Be positive. Keep in mind that this is job search for the candidate, so they are actively looking for a new environment and want to learn about all options.<n><n>## Additional Information:<n><n>Betty will answer this correctly<n><n>### Exploration and Learning<n><n>Betty does not understand the concept of "Exploration and Learning"<n><n>### How long have your been a working?<n><n>Betty has been working for

If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:The student needed to  get some new pencils, where did he go? Choices:  A: store B: classroom C: backpack D: cabinet E: teacher<n><n>### Response:		 <n>If A was chosen, the student chose to go to the store. The answer is A. If C was chosen, the student needed the pencils in his or her classes or from an earlier time in the school day. The answer is C. If B was chosen, the student went to the teacher. The answer is B. If D was chosen,the student searched for pencils using a container or desk in the cabinet. The answer is D. If E was chosen, the student got the pencils directly from the teacher. The answer it is E.  If F was chose, the student went to a different location where pencils or a container where stored. The answer is F.<n><n>### Input : If the first student has 45 books in her library, how much money does she need to open a bank account for a new purchase? Choices: <n><n>1 $10.00<n>2 $5.00<n>3 $50.00<n>4 $2.50<n>5 $5.50<n><n>### Respond:<n><n>If A was chosen then the student had enough money to open a bank account. The answer is One.If C was chosen then the student does not have enough money to open a new bank account. The answer if five.<n><n>### This question only applies if B was chosen.<n><n>### If D was chosen, then the student does not need to know the number of books in her library. Therefore only one answer choice was correct.<n><n>### The answer is B.<n>### Answer:<n><n>1 A.A=2001,B=2021,C=2041,D=2061

You could say “the same” variable for different variables but for the same variable, using the same variable is different. Example: If the variable ‘A’ represents different people, then A = ‘A’ for both values and both values will have the same variable. The same way is used in the above sentence.<n><n>### Example:<n><n>> I got this assignment as a child and I still got it.<n>Response: This can be a toy

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:Where would someone learn to play an upright piano? Choices:  A: music room B: music store C: music class D: medium E: house<n><n>### Response:		<n>This question is difficult to answer. This is an example of a poorly worded instruction. I would like to answer your question, but I need more information.<n><n>In [my other post that was 10/1/2020]<n><n>```<n>Response:<n>It looks like we need a larger house, but I don't think we can afford it.<n>```<n><n>If you want an additional answer, please provide [my other post that mentions what I need to get the answer to the question]<n><n>### Input:"There are currently 4 billion people in the world, the number of people every year is approximately 1% of the population. If the population grows at 1%, what will 100 billion be? How many years?<n><n>### Response<n>The input has several problems. The first problem occurs once it has already divided the population, then it wants us to add 1%, then divide by 0.01.<n><n>The input should have been:<n><n>```<n>Input:The number of people is going up at 1% per year. What will be 100 billion people after 50 years?<n>```<n>Also, the output should have been a single number such at "Approximately 5,000,000,750" The question is asking you to do math with large numbers, so the output should also include large numbers.<n><n>This is a better way to format what I want.<n>```<n>Input: How many years and people will it take for the population to double?<n>```<n><n>Your answer to this is 50 years<n><n>The formula is<n>$$2*2.01*2 = 8.01*2$$<n>$$2 + 2.01 + 2.02 = 8 + 8.02$$.<n><n>So, a population of 1 person has a total of $2+2.01+2.02=8$,<n>a population of $2$ persons has a total of $4+2.02+2.04=8+2.02$<n><n>After $3$ people we have $$4+2.03+2.06=8+10.09$$.<n>So, the general form is: $2*2x2 = 4x(2

Choices:  A: at the zoo B: south carolina C: hen house D: louisiana E: arkansas<n><n>### Response:		C<n><n>### Input<n>> *If one sees a foxto be honest with that personis standing ona landlocked southern state.*<n>><n>> *Choices:A *the zoo*B *South Carolina*C *The hen house*E *Arkansas**<n><n>### Demonsation<n><n>![answer-pic](/github/assets/pic/Answer.png)<n><n><n>### Input  <n><n>```python<n>>>> #import the necessary packages<n>```  <n>```python<n>from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression<n>```<n>![model-pic](/github/contents/pic/model.png)<n><n>### Input2<n><n>```python<n>#create data<n><n>X = [1,2,3]<n>Y = [0,1,-1]<n><n>```  <n>```p1ython<n>#create lrm model<n><n>model = LinearRegression()<n>```  <n>```pyhton<n>#regress against predicted value<n><n>y_pred = model.predict(np.array(x))<n>#predictions<n><n>for i, y in enumerate(y_pred):<n>    print("i and y: {}: {:.2f}".format(i, y), end = "\n")<n>```  <n>```Python<n>#regression analysis<n><n>from sklearn.metrics import r2_score<n><n>r2_score(y_true, y_pred)<n>```  <n>![output-pic](/github/contrib/pic/output.png)    <n>```python<n>#regression analysis  <n>```  <n>```<n>#regression analysis    <n>```  <n><n>### Demo Instruction<n><n>```Python<n>def read (): <n>    #read<n>```  <n><n>```Python<n>#demonstrate regression analysis<n>data = {x: [], y: []} <n>n = 10 <n><n>for i in range(n): <n>    #sample data generation<n><n>    data[x].append(np.random.normal()*(n-1)) <n>    data[y].append(int(np.random.choice(5)))<n>```  <n><n>![demo-pic](/github/contribute/pic/demo.png)<n><n>```Python<n>reg = LinearRegression() <n>```<n>![regrssion-pic](/github/

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:Billy went away because his parents were fighting and he didn't want to stay where? Choices:  A: home team B: present C: at home D: come back E: charming<n><n>### Response:		A<n><details><summary>Show Answer</summary><n><n>- First find the total length of the string.<n>- Then split into space<n>- For each string cut it with 'char'<n>- For each string add the index with the string. <n>- Sum them all up to get the length of the string. <n><n>```python<n>def add(n):<n>   total = 0<n>   for x in range(1, n + 1):<n>       total = total +x<n><n>   return total<n><n>def delaun(string):<n>   length = 0<n>   total_length = add(len(str(string)))<n><n>   for char in str(string):<n>      length = length +1 + ('char' + str(char))<n><n>   return length<n>```<n></details><n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:James lived in the top of a tall tower.  He could see clouds when he looked out his window.  Where might he live? Choices:  A: in books B: radio station C: city D: tower E: medieval castle<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>The tower would be a medieval castle, because:<n><n> * **In the past, castles were used for protection**<n> * **Castles are in the sky or top of a mountain**<n> * **Tallest tower is the Eiffel tower**<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following 5 choice multiple choice question. Write your answer as an integer.<n> * **Input:In a recent survey, 1125 adults were surveyed. After the survey, it was found that 521 respondents drank coffee. If 32 more adults didn't drink coffee, how many more cups of coffee would they have consumed then?**<n> * **Input:A bag of gummy worms has 35 pieces and a bag of gummy bears has 126 pieces. If the gummy foods are counted by 6's and 5 each, how many gummies would be in a bag with a total of 656 pieces.**<n> * **Input:(0.893)2 + (0.847)2**<n><n>### Response(Instructions) 1:<n><n>To find the total number of adults, add 32 and 1125.<n>The total number of adults is 1157.<n>The number of adults who drank coffee is<n><n>\[Adults_{Who\_Drank\_Coffee}\]<n>\[= \dfrac{521}{1157}\approx.45\]<n><n> * Note: This equals to 45%<n><n>### Response 2:<n><n>The number of pieces of gummies in the total bag is<n><n>\[Total\_Pieces\_Bag\]<n>\[= \frac{35+126}{2}\approx 319\]<n><n>### Instuction:1. Solve the equation 5\^3 + 6\^3 = 74\^3 2. A rectangle has a width of 8 and a length that is 3 feet more than twice it's area.What is the length?<n> * **Input:What is the product of 10 and 3?**<n><n>### Input1:<n>The equation of 5\^3+6\^

An answer is an option from the choices. In this case this is a multiple choice question for the response.<n><n>### Question:<n>What are some tips for creating a strong response?<n><n>### Demos:<n>A: The correct grammatical form is the subjunctive<n><n>### Response<n>A: The correct grammar form is the subjunktive because we are talking about something that does not happen. Thus the subjunctive form is right.<n><n>### Explication<n>A: When we choose an object or subject, the object or subject is in the past so the right subjunctive form must be used.<n><n>### Answer<n>A:The correct grammatical form of the sentence is the subjunctives because you are using the sentence object instead of the sentence subject.<n><n>### Note:<n>Make sure that your answer has 3 points of information<n><n>### Demo:<n>A: The best way of learning is by listening to yourself, as the same way would teach it.<n><n>### Response for response<n>A: The best ways of learning anything is by listening and watching it happening. The best way of learning by listening and watching.<n><n>### Tip for response<n>A: There are three ways to learn the grammar: by listening, by reading and by writing.<n><n>### Demo for response<n>A:There are two ways of talking to some people: by listening and by reading.<n><n>### Respond for demos<n>A: There are 3 ways to use the English language properly: by listening, writing or by reading.<n><n><n>### Note to demos<n>Make sure your demo gives details, gives a reason and give the most important details<n><n>### Demo:<n>A: Some are the most important thing in life is to give people the right tools and the skills they need.

Choices:  A: fall asleep B: relaxation C: deafness D: bored E: calm<n><n>### Response:		 E<n>Output:  E<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>```js<n>'use strict'<n>  console.log(<n>    'The value of the second letter of the Fibonacci sequence is: ',<n>    fibonacci(2),<n>  );<n>  <n>  function fibonacci(n) {<n>     if (n === 0) {<n>       return 0;<n>     }<n>  else if (n === 1) {<n>     	return 1;<n>     }<n>    else<n>       return fibonacci(n - 1) + fibonacci(n-2);<n>  }<n>```<n><n>### Output:<n>```js<n>'The value of the second number in the fibonacci sequence is: 1'<n>```<n><n>## Description:<n>### Instruction 1:<n>Create a function called fibonacci (it returns the second element in a Fibonacci sequence to the element passed in), then use recursion and pseudo code to write the function.<n>#### Output<n>#### Example Input<n>```js<n>'fibonacci(3)'<n>```<n>

Identify the form of the word(e.g. adjective or adverb).<n><n>1. The big fat pizza was a lot pizza for just a litle guy. (Adjective + for)<n>2. I can't find anything that fits perfectly in your room.  (Adverb + that)<n>3. I'm going to my boyfriend's party this weekend.  (Adjective + this)<n><n>#### Explanation:<n>An adverb describes a verb, an adjective describes a noun or pronoun, and a preposition describes a noun or a pronoun. <n><n>Sometimes a preposition can be an adverb by changing the form of the word (e.g. "I can't find" is the adverbial form of "I cannot find"). <n><n>1. An adverb is needed to describe how "big" the pizza is, and to describe how much "fat" the pizza has.<n>2. An adjective is needed to describe how well the clothes fit the guest, or to describe the party ("little" and "boyfriend" are pronouns).<n>3. A noun, "party", is needed to describe the event.<n><n>Answer:<n>1. fat pizza (adverb)<n>2. anything (adjective)<n>3. party / boyfriend (nouns)<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:Parents often yell in times of chaos, what are they trying to do? Choices:  A: guide children B: understand children C: control children D: care for children E: vent anger<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>```sh<n>#!/bin/bash -l<n><n>ageA=$(date -d '40 years ago' +%s)<n>ageB=$(date -d '20 years ago' + %s)<n>diff=11<n><n>#Find the number of years for Hurley<n>minutesA="$(( $ageA- $ageB ))"<n>secondsA="$(( $minutesA % 60 ))"<n>minutesB="$(( (60 - $secondsA) ))"<n>hoursB="$(( $minutesB / 60 ))";<n><n>#Now find the difference<n>hurley=$(($hoursB * 60))<n><n>#Convert to seconds and add 20<n>diffTime=$(($diff + $hurley))<n><n>### Calculate the age after<n>dif=$(($2 + $diffTime))<n><n>echo "$diff"<n>```<n>

Choices:  A: amusement park B: urban area C: airport D: shopping malls E: train station<n><n>### Response:		 D <n>```<n><tr><td align="left"><b>If you are in <i>Nob Hill</i> shoppingmall area you will not have to make any stop or parking. If in other malls you can park your vehicles in parking lots only and take cabs to reach your place. So you need to find places where you can park easily.<n>Also if your family will come with you, then amusement park will be nice place to have all with you at a place.<n><n>So I will choose only D, because I have two reasons in my mind, one is my shops at this mall are nearby to this, and two you don't have to make an extra stop for reach to your places if you are in this area. So there is no transportation cost, but in other malls I have to travel for reach to my places and in shopping malls. </b></td></tr><n>```<n>### Input: What was the name of the 16-year-old girl whose body was found in 1976?<n>Answer: Stephanie<n><n>### Response :<b>In 2012, a body believed to be that of the missing California teenager   Stephanie Anne Carlie Moore was discovered   near  the  crash site of a plane crash in northern  California. (I would also recommend not using lower case `input_` in any case because in JS, property names are case sensitive)<n><n>Answer: This response is invalid:<n><n>\begin{code}<n>### Demonstraion:<n>Input: The diffrence between Richard and Hurley, is 20<n>If Hurley is 13 years, what are their combined age 40 years from the present?<n><n># Demonstraion.<n>##### Output : 126<n>\end{code]<n><n>The response must start with either `{ // ` for object or `[[ // ` for array.<n><n>The response is incorrect:<n><n>\begin {code}<n>### Input: If you're known to by presents for others often, you'd be called what? Choices: B: gift buyer.<n>\end{code}'<n>\end{code}{<n><n>There are no such things in JS as string literals called `'....'` - they're literal strings, and are not surrounded by any quotes. This is an invalid syntax.<n><n>This is how you write string literals in JS:<n><n>\begin '{ "question1": "what is 5 + 5", "question2": "What does `Hello` mean?" }'<n><n>The following is an example of JS code containing some strings. Again note that the literal strings are not surrounded by quotes<n><n>\begin{blockquote}<n><n>\begin{pre}<n>const say_hi = () => `good

One is that the examples have no errors and the other one is that they have errors so to get the expected result we must do the error detection and the error fixing. We also have to fix the input and output of the functions and add the empty parenthesis for the function to be called.

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:My house is very dry, with little water in the air. What tool should I use to fix this? Choices:  A: humidifier B: surface of earth C: skating rink D: ice cube E: burn it to the ground<n><n>### Response:		I have lived in arid climates for most of my life, so I know the ins and outs of such conditions. I also know that most homes that are dry are either not ventilated properly, or use an excessive amount of heat in the winter. To remedy your house's air, I suggest you install an air purifier. These devices remove moisture from the air by causing water to condense on the surface of them, then the water is collected and used to irrigate your lawn.<n><n>### Input<n>The sum of two numbers is 13. Their difference is 4. Choose the number that is 4 more than one and three times the other.<n><n>### Response<n>To answer this request, I use the following calculation.<n><n>```<n> 5 - 4 = 1<n>```<n><n>Since the first calculation involves addition, I also use addition to express the solution in terms of the following number.<n><n>```<n>5 + (5 − 4) = 5 + 1 = 6<n>```<n><n>Since 6 is 4 more than 2, both can be combined to create the result.<n><n>```<n>6 + 2 = 8<n>```<n><n>### Input :<n>If 25% of a number is 2, what is 70% of the number?<n><n>### Response :<n>This is a good opportunity to demonstrate a calculation.<n><n>```python<n>25 * 0.300 = 2<n>70 * 0.700 = 49<n>```<n><n>## Solution<n>The following is a solution to the original request.<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:If there is a stale smell in the air coming from the kitchen, what should one check for the source of the smell? Choices:  A: bathroom B: house C: cupboard D: space shuttle E: surface of earth<n><n>### Response:		<n>   <n>The stale smell in air comes from the kitchen, so, the person may check the cooker and other things in the kitchen to remove or find the source of smell <n><n>### Justification:<n>1. Choice A: Bathroom: It will not be the stale smell coming from bathroom, I think that the smell come from kitchen because of the cooker, which is the most common source of smell. That's why you need not check bathroom because there is no smell coming from it.<n><n>2. Choice B: House: Yes the house will not be the source of smell since you live there for quite a long. Moreover there is no smell, that's why you live there for quite long.<n><n><n>3. Choice C: Cupboard: It may contain the food item which goes bad after some time, so you need to check in cupboard in kitchen to  find if there is any smell<n><n>4. Choice D: Space Shuttle: I think it is not relevant. <n><n>5. Choice E: Earth Surface: It will not be source of smell because there won't be any smell from earth surface, since it will be the place where you live.    <n><n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:Where do you wait in a reception area for a meeting? Choices:  A: hall B: motel C: hotels D: law firm E: office building<n><n>### Response:		Richard and Hurley are 40 years old (each). So in 20 years, (Richard + Hurley) = 40 + 40 = 80. And again in 40 years, (Richards + Hurley) + 20 = 60 + 120 = 180.<n><n>### Output: (40 + 80 + 40 + 180) ÷ 4 =  128<n><n><n><n><n>[Back](../Readme.md)<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:Mary was a bad girl, but she was always open about that.  People liked her because she was what? Choices:  A: excellent B: fun C: honest D: worthy E: choice<n><n>### Response:		 B: Fun, C: Honest<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>Write the code to do the task specified<n><n>### Demosntration:<n><n>```javascript<n>function example() {<n>    var input = "The difference in ages between Richard";<n>    var input = input + " and Hurley is 128 years from now, Hurley is ";<n>    var input = "\nIn a single word, people like her because she is:  ";<n><n>    var output = "Mary was a bad "<n><n>    output += " girl, but she was "<n>    <n>    output += " open "<n>    <n>    if (/[1-4]/.test(input.length)) {<n>    <n>        output += " about that."<n>    }<n>    <n>    else {<n>        output += ", <n><n>        people liked her because she "<n>    }<n>     if (/fun$/.test(output.length)) {<n>        output += " her ";<n>        output += " she"<n>        <n>    }<n>    else {<n>        <n>        output += "her";<n><n>    }<n>     output += " is " + input.substr(input.length-2) + "." <n>     console.log(output);<n>}<n> ```

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:What do you do to hold loose papers together? Choices:  A: tighten B: packaged C: bound D: faithful E: compact<n><n>### Response:		<n>"D"<n><n>### 📌 Demonstration of Answer:<n>Expected response: A: tighten B. packaged C: bound  D. faithful E. compact<n><n>### Explanation of Answer:<n><n>### 1. <n>Let n be the current age of a person, then n = ∑ (40 / x)<n>Where (40/x) is the amount that has been added to each year. <n>As expected, a.t. (40/x)'s answer is zero, while the other answers has nonzero values<n><n>### 2.<n>We need to solve the equation below:<n><n>![Solution](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/3c/Mathematical_Equations.svg/1024px-Mathematical_Equation)<n><n>### 3.<n>Choices below are choices that describe the task of binding a loose papers.<n><n>| choice   | explanation               |<n>|------------|:----------------|<n>| A | To add adhesive or glue to stick two sheets, such as books and newspapers |<n>| B | To create or make a set of sheets by placing them in a cover, such as a set of books or dictionaries |<n>| C | To prepare paper pages from one another |<n>| D | To give firm loyalty to someone or something |<n>| E | To form something into a compact shape or size as when paper is folded together |<n><n>### 4.<n>I got confused on choosing the answer because it stated the question as an age difference, but it was really about two people working together in the near future.<n><n>I chose the "faithful" as the answer because the other options were not correct, but it was not clear about the age difference or it was about two people working together.<n><n>

If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:What kind of driving leads to accidents? Choices:  A: stressful B: dangerous C: fun D: illegal E: deadly<n><n>### Response:		<n>Input: The distance from New York City to San Francisco is 2500 miles. If one drives 80 miles per hour from New York to San Francisco, what is the best estimate of the time it takes to drive?<n><n>### Explanation<n><n>Because the formula for the distance is D = RT and R = 2500 mi and T = 2/80 mi/hr, divide 2550 by 80, which gives you around 31 hours and 15 minutes.<n>The time it takes to travel from San Francisco to New York is 2550 miles / 80 mph, which is approximately 31.8 to 32 hours which are the same.<n><n>### Response<n><n>The instructions stated that you must add 30 miles to the original 10 mile distance.<n><n>### Expected output:<n><n>The total distance from Cedar Hill to North Hills is 72.22 miles.

If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:The evacuation became mandatory, so what came on the TV? Choices:  A: advisory B: mandate C: soap opera D: elective E: optional<n><n>### Response:		E<n><n>### Explanations<n><n>### Sample Answer 1:<n>- Hurley:14<n>- Richard:28 40 years later would be : 58+14 =62<n>- their combined age would = 62<n><n>### Sample Response 1:<n>- Their combined age would = 70<n>- Hurley: (14-20)/20 = 12<n>- Richard: (28-20)/28 = -8<n>- Their combined age 40 yrs from now = Hurley's current age + 40, Richard's current age - 40<n>- Hurley's age 40 yr from now is 58

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:James felt himself losing consciousness.  He was frightened.  He didn't want this.  He was scared of what? Choices:  A: death B: coma C: peace D: forgetfulness E: loss of life<n><n>### Response:		<n>The options were:<n><n>1. A:  Death<n>2. B: Coma<n>3. C: Peace<n>4. D:Forgetfulness<n>5. E: Loss of life<n><n>But, as you should understand now, these questions can be answered via "code" (or "language").<n><n>Your response should be a 3 line string, or 4 if you want to be a rebel.<n>The first line should be a line of code for the question, it must be in Java-like syntax.  This can be done by putting any character before the line, and followed by the number of the question, then any punctuation before you write the line of code.  The second line must also do the same, but must change the input line to a line of code. You can change this to be anything you like, but the line of code must be a valid line of code in any code.  There can be a maximum of 3 questions.<n><n>-<n><n>### Example:<n>First one:<n><n>```java<n>System.out.println("4");<n>```<n><n>The code that corresponds to question 4 above.<n><n>The second one:<n><n>```python<n>def printQuestion(number):<n>    num = input()<n>    if number not in range(1,51):<n>        print ("You can not have more than 3 questions")<n>        <n>    else:<n>        numberOfPunctuation = sys.maxwidth<n>        print ("input: " + str(num) +"\n" + str((numberOfPunctuation)))<n>        num = input()<n><n>printQuestion(1)<n>```<n><n>The input and output that corresponds to the question for line 2. Note the spaces on the last line.<n><n>The third one, which can be done for the first question:<n><n>```python, (but I don't think it counts because I used two print lines)<n>def printQuestion( number ) : <n>    if number not >= 1 and not <= 50 :<n>        print("You can not have more tan 3 questions")<n>    else :<n>        intToPrintSpace = len( str(number).rjust(len(str( 51 - number ) )) )<n>        num = input( num )<n>    <n>print ( number ) <n>```<n><n>Note I

In 1972, I started Oracle Corporation's database business in the United States.<n><n>Hurley:I have a bache's degree in Business and a photography graduate from Brooks Institute of PhotoJournalism.<n><n>### Input<n>Richard:When I was a boy, my grandmother died one year before I turned age ten and then my parents died two years later when I was thirteen. You can replace the words **different in each line with** "the sum of the squares..." <n>### Demontration:<n>Input:The sum of the squares of a line and another line, such that the lengths of the lines are 4 and 2.<n><n>Answer: 4<n>### Instruction In everyday math, people are used to subtracting with the word  “differences in each line,” but in the sum of the squares of two line, the problem is “the sum of squares”<n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: the sum of the squares in a line:<n>Output: the sum of the square of a line<n><n>### Instraction:<n>In everyday math, people might subtract with the word “difference in each line”but when the sum of the squares is multiplied by the values in the two different lines, use “the sum of the squares of the lines”.<n><n>Input: Sum of the squares of two lines A and B are:<n><n>A= 5, and B = 12<n><n>Output: A = 25, since it will be multiplied by 5, and B will multiply by 12 to get: 130

This company needs to develop a marketing plan that can allow it to stay relevant in the future. At the same time, it must be innovative so it can keep up with technological growth to ensure that its products and services that customers have an option to continue using them.<n><n>Businesses have a competitive advantage that can help them to gain market share so they can keep expanding their influence. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:The woman picked from an apple tree while surrounded by other trees, where was she? Choices:  A: illinois B: woods C: new york D: indiana E: farmer's market<n><n>### Response:		<n>1. In this problem you have 4 letters in the word. The first letter is I, the second letter is L, which is 11, The forth letter is L, which when added together creates an 11 (I =1, L=12). The fifth letter is O, which is the eighth letter. The fourth letter is S, which is 19. The sum of these numbers is 11. The fifth letter is A, which is 1. The sum of these number is 12.<n><n>The next step comes in as you think about the problem being presented to you. You think that the next letter is not in the word, since the last letter is O, and we know from above that The sum of these number (the fourth and fifth number) equals the 11 we calculated. <n><n>Finally, the word has 6 letters, you have already eliminated 5 letters, this leaves us with 1 letter. <n>In summary, the word we are looking for is ILLINOIS.<n><n>### Input2:<n>The man picked from an apple tree. The difference in ages between the two boys is 11. Their ages combined is 30. If Jack is 3 years old and John is 7, what is the product of their ages when they are 9 and 1 years past?<n><n>#### Answer: Jack is 3 year and John is 7 years. Then combined they are 10 years and 9 years is added to the total to get 19.<n>#### Jack - 3<n>3 * 3 - 3 * 3 = 18<n>And from above<n>6 * 11 = 66<n>11 * 9 = 100<n><n><n>### Input3:<n><n><n>#include <cstdio><n>#include<iostream><n>#include <vector><n>#include <algorithm><n>#include <stdio.h><n>#include <stdlib.h><n>#define maxN 200001<n>#define INF 10000005<n><n><n>using namespace std;<n><n>int main()<n><n>{<n><n>	int t,n;<n>	scanf("%d",&t);<n><n>	vector<int> arr;<n><n>	int sum = 0;<n>	int min

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:Where would you find a sign with some people lined up next to it? Choices:  A: bus stop B: street corner C: roadblock D: fast food drive thru E: city<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Input:`What is the sum of the number of students in this group and the number of students in that group?`<n><n>### Response:`41`<n><n>### Instructions:Write a statement that returns the result of subtracting the total number of students in a group from the total number of students on the floor.<n><n>### Input : `Group One contains 15 students.`<n><n>### Response : `15 – 5 = 10`<n><n>### Input:"There are 50 students in my class. Write a statement that will print all of their names in alphabetical order."<n><n>### Response:'List is "A", B, C, D, E...'<n>### Response : 'List is "A", "AB", "ABC","BC...'<n><n>### Response :- "B" and "C" and so on.<n><n>### Solution :<n>```python<n>#Input "The class contains 50 students."<n><n>def count(A):<n>     return len(A)<n><n>def list(A, B, C):<n>  for i in range(50):<n>    if i<count(A): B+=i;<n>    elif i<count(A)>i<count(B): C+=i;<n>    else: D+=(i-count(B))<n>    print(F"{B}\t{C}")<n>```<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:Where does a spoon go on one side of a plate? Choices:  A: bowl of soup B: serving dish C: table setting D: placemat E: glass of iced tea<n><n>### Response:		<n>A is the correct answer. Choices a) and b) imply moving a spoon to a dish and a place or serving dish is in the dish rack and a table setting is for a person to set out, which the spoon is not. D is wrong because a placemat, not a plate, goes on one side of a place. C is wrong because a serving dish has space on the top for a person to put food and a placemat is on the bottom. E is wrong because the spoon would not go with food, it would be dry and so the spoon would go on the side of a glass of iced tea.<n><n><a href="https://www.acmicpc.net/problem/1001"><img src="https://cdn.acmicpc.nexcesscdn.net/problemfiles/1001.jpg" border="0" width="240px" height="240px"></a><n><n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following multiple-choice question.<n>### Input: Where does a spoon go one side of a plate. Choices: A: bowl of Soup B: serving dish. C: table setting D placemat. E: glass of ices tea.<n><n>### Response：<n>A is the correct anwer. Choices(a) and (b) imply moving the spoon to a dishing dish and a dish glass is racked on a dish rack and the table set is for a person to make a table setting that the spoon is not correct<n>dishes (c) table set is placed. C and D is the incorrect location of the spoon because it would go on the edge of a plate to be able to pick up food.<n>E is the incorrect answer because the food spoon should be placed on the surface of a glass of lemonade.<n><n><a <n><n><n>1000 <n><n>### Instroduction:Answer the following multiple selection questions.<n><n>### demosntration: <n>input and output : The sum of Hurley's age and Richard's age is16 more than four times Richard's age. It should then compare the inputted string to each character found in the C Programming Language: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/C_programming_language The program must return the correct string followed by:<n><n>1. A list of the matching characters, with character numbers and string positions.<n>2. An error message when an inputted string cannot be processed<n><n>### Demand:<n>Input:<n><n>```C#<n>string mystring1 = "C";<n>string mystring2 = "A";<n>```<n>Output:<n><n>```C%<n>string mystring1 - "C"<n>string mystring2 - "A"<n>```  <n><n>### Demostration: <n><n>```C# <n>string A = "A";<n>string B = "C";<n><n>for (int i = 0; A[i]!= B[i]; i++) <n>    Console.WriteLine(A[i]);<n>```  <n><n><n>### Answer the following multiple choice question:<n><n>1. D: A stands for an Object.<n>A: A stands for an array.<n>### Answer<n>```C#  public static void main()<n>    {<n>        int x;<n>        int[] y;<n>        sub()<n>        {<n>            console.write("give me the value of x:"  x = x + 12 / 3;<n>            Console.WriteLine("the value of x is " + x);<n>            console.write( "give me the value y:");<n>            y = Console.ReadLine();<n>            Console.WriteLine ("The array is {" + y[0] + "," + y[1];<n>        }<n>    }   <n>```  <n><n>2. Below is an instruction that describes a task. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:What chore might a child have to do after breakfast, before getting on the bus? Choices:  A: drop out of school B: ask questions C: enter school D: wash dishes E: read book<n><n>### Response:		<n>*Option A is wrong since children go to school.*<n>*Option B is wrong since children go the bus.*<n>*Option C is right.*<n>*Option D is correct.*<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>### Input and Example:<n><n>*Input*<n>>What chore might a 16 year old have to do after school, before going to homework?   <n>>Choices: A: drop out of highschool B: ask questions C ask homework  D: wash dinners E: read books <n>><n>>Example: What chore might a 24 year old have to do before getting on the bus in the morning? <n>>Answers:  A: drop school  B: ask questions  C : ask homework  D wash dinners  E read books <n><n>### Demostration:<n>*Input*<n>What chore might a highschool have to do after school before going to homework.<n><n>*Options*<n>A: drop out of school   <n>B: ask questions  <n>C: ask homework D: wash dings E: read book<n>*Response*<n>Cask homework since it's a 16 yearold highschooler.<n><n>### Input<n> What task might a 16-year-old have do in an interview for a car loan. <n> <n> *Options*<n> 	1: drop out of high school<n> 	2: ask questions<n> 	3: ask homework<n> 	4: wash dishes<n> 	5: read books<n> <n> *Response*<n> *1* is wrong since it's probably be too young<n> *2* is wrong since it would probably be before 16<n> *3* is wrong since it might be a question or homework from the interviewer<n> *4* is wrong since people who get car loans are older because they make more money<n> *5 is right*<n><n>### Input/Example<n><n>Input: What might a 8 year old do before bed? <n>Answer : Read book<n><n>Input: What would a 20 year old do before they had to go to school in the morning?<n>Answer: Ask questions<n><n>Input: What chore might I have to do after breakfast before going to school?<n>Answer: Wash dishes<n>

Configure Cisco Unified Computing System.<n><n>Cisco ACI Network Associate Certificate will give you the skills required to understand the concepts of the programmable infrastructure and be able to use them to solve real-world problems.<n>It is designed for the IT architects, network engineers, network planners and IT consultants. Students may not get a job when they complete this course, but that is not one of the important features of this course. The main purpose of this course is to learn the principles used to set up the Software Programmable data center and how you can use them to solve the problems.<n><n>### Exam Details:<n>This exam is made to examine a candidate's skills of configuring the basic requirements of Cisco Software Programmable Data Center on the Cisco Unified computers. To take this exam you need to have basic knowledge of the TCP / IP network and a working experience with Linux UNIX operating systems.<n><n>### Syllabus topics <n>- Network concepts<n>- Basics of Cisco ACI<n>- Network security <n>- Configuration of Network<n>- Basic Cisco ACS<n>- Cisco UCS basics<n>These are the main topics of this course you need to remember to pass the exam.<n><n>### Resources:<n>The Cisco network learning center and the online documentation can help you a lot in preparing for the Cisco exams.<n><n>The free Cisco certified associate exams can be used as a preparation tool to study for CCIE. They have some questions similar to the ones in the real exam, so they can give you an idea of the level of complexity of the questions in the exam.<n><n>If you are ready to go to a higher level, then go to a lab, like Packet. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:John is a human who is in a wheelchair due to an accident.  Where would he go to get to the third floor of his apartment building? Choices:  A: space shuttle B: detroit C: stairs D: downtown E: elevator<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>>Because john will go to detroit<n><n><n>### What should your response include?<n><n>#### Solution<n>```<n>const getAgeCombinedFortyYearsMoreThanHurleys40YearsLater = (youngerAge, olderAge) => {<n>  let totalAge = youngerAge + olderAge;<n>  let olderAge40YearsLate = olderAge + youngerAge * 10;<n>  if (typeof totalAge === 'number') {<n>    totalAge += 80;<n>    return totalAge - olderAge40YearsoLate;<n>  }<n>  return -1;<n>};<n><n>console.log(getAgeCombinedFiftyYearsMoreThan30YearsLater(10, 50));<n>//> 60<n>```
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The difference in ages between Richard and Hurley is 20. If Hurley is 14 years old, what are their combined ages 40 years from now?<n>Answer: 128<n><n>### Input:One might find theirs open, with the letters that had been delivered stolen. Choices:  A: front door B: newspaper C: post office D: package E: mail box<n><n>### Response:		What is the only one choice that is a real choice, not the rest of them.<n><n><n><n><n>### My Solution<n><n>```js<n>const myAnswer = (answer);<n>if  (answer==="D" || answer==="E")  return Answer = answer<n> if  (answer==="A")  return Answer = "B"<n>  if  (answer==='B")  return Answer = ""<n>  if  (question==='C')  return Answer = "D"<n>else  return "Wrong answer"<n>```<n><n>### Code that was Given:<n>`function myAnswer(answer) {<n>if (answer==="D")  return Answer = true<n>if (answer==='E')  return Answer = true <n>if (answer==="#A")  return Answer="B"<n>if (answer===("B"))  return Answer = false <n>if (answer<(#C))  return Answer="D"<n> else return "Wrong answer"; <n>}<n>// This function accepts an answer, returns the truthy value if correct.<n>// Here truthy is true and falsey is anything less than zero.<n><n>console.log(answer,"is this correct")<n>if(answer== "true")  {<n>console.log("YES that was correct")<n>}<n>if(answer=="D")return "YES its correct";<n>if(answer=="E")return "YES its a correct answer";<n>if(answer==="#A")return "is true is no right answer";<n>if(answers=="B")return "No that is incorrect";<n>if(answer<=2)return "Sorry thats falsey"<n>```<n><n><n>### The right answer is:<n><n>```js<n><n>const myAnswer = function (answer) {<n>  if (answer == "a")  return true; <n>  if (answer!= null)  return true;<n>  else  return false;<n>}<n><n>```<n><n>
